Multiplication of 2 matrices.question:
Evaluate the matrix \( T = AB \), where \( A \) and \( B \) are given matrices:
\[ A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, \quad B = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}. \]

Finding the mean median and mode.question:
The table shows the shoe sizes of 60 people:
\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Shoe size} & 5 & 6 & 7 & 8 & 9 \\
\hline
\text{Frequency} & 24 & x & 13 & y & 5 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
Given that the mean shoe size is 6.3, determine the median and mode shoe sizes.
Finding the mean median and mode.answer: The median shoe size is 6, and the mode shoe size is 5.

Applying the angles properties of circle.question: In the diagram, \( A \), \( B \), and \( C \) are three points on a circle with center \( O \). Given that \( AOP \) is a diameter of the circle and angle \( \angle COP = 68^\circ \), find \( \angle ABC \).

Applying rates in real-world contexts.question:
The rates of renting a car by two car rental companies are as shown:
\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Company A} & \text{Company B} \\
\hline
\$11 \text{ per hour for the first 4 hours} & \$30 \text{ for the first 2 hours} \\
\$8 \text{ per half-hour thereafter} & \$12 \text{ per hour thereafter} \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
Kenneth plans to rent a car for 6 hours. Which company should he rent the car from so that he pays less?

Finding the probability of single events.question:
A bag contains three types of coffee sachets: 9 are caramel flavoured, 11 are hazelnut flavoured, and 12 are vanilla flavoured.
(a) A sachet is chosen at random.
What is the probability that it is not vanilla flavoured?

Evaluating an algebraic formula.question: The length, breadth, and height of a cuboid are \( l \) cm, \( b \) cm, and \( h \) cm respectively. Find the volume \( V \) when \( l = 8 \), \( b = 3 \), and \( h = 5 \).
